text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen well here 
in Vancouver we finally have our summer this

year I think this is the first warm weekend in a 
long time people are starting to bring out their

barbecue so I thought I would share with you a 
really classic Thai recipe that you can put on

your barbecue I'm making kaw moo yang kaw moo is 
pork neck literally and yang means to grill and

when we say pork neck we actually mean pork jowl 
which is one of the tastiest and underappreciated

cut in the pig so let's take a look at what this 
recipe is all about let's get started so this is

pork jowl and you can't mistake it for anything 
it's a very unique looking piece it's very thin

now in Thailand they tend to leave more of a fat 
on this but here they've taken most of the fat on

that's okay but if you like fatty grilled pork 
leave more of the fat on if you can now I get

this at an Asian grocery store you might need to 
look at either Asian source or specialized butcher

for this it's a little hard to find okay so the 
marinade is very simple in a really classic Thai

barbecue marinade actually we're gonna start 
out with some white peppercorns and want to

just grind that up first and I like to grind dry 
stuff separately because once you start adding

herbs and whatnot they don't grind as well all 
right so now that it's nice and fine I'm gonna

add my herbs I have got some garlic some thinly 
sliced lemongrass and some cilantro stems if you

can find cilantro roots you can go ahead and add 
that I don't have them anymore woo off they go

and now you want to get this pretty fine so now 
that it looks kind of like a paste it will smell

amazing ah mmm so good now I'm gonna add some palm 
sugar you can't just use regular white sugar for

this if you don't have it and I'm gonna pound this 
just to make sure they're all dissolved all right

so now that your sugar is dissolved now you could 
just finish everything in here I'm gonna transfer

it into a clear bowl so you guys can see better 
and by the way this marinade is good on chicken

you can use it on beef whatever you want to throw 
on the barbecue on chicken wings would be so good

now I'm gonna add my liquid seasoning and that is 
some oyster sauce some basic Thai pantry staple

ingredients some soy sauce to add aroma richness 
and also some liquid so that it absorbs into the

park I'm gonna add some coconut milk now some 
people in Thailand like to use evaporated milk

instead these days I prefer using coconut milk 
it's more traditional and also now it's very free

so I don't have to worry about somebody having 
issues and give this a good stir and that's pretty

much it that's a marinade right there now I'm just 
gonna put my marinade all over the pork and that's

it I like to do this a day in advance so I it can 
have a whole day to marinate but if you can get a

couple of hours that's just fine and there's quite 
a bit of liquid here the pork is gonna absorb much

of that into the meat for any Thai barbecue you 
want to have something called nam Tim tau as your

dipping sauce now I've made them team tau in a 
couple other recipes so put those links in the

description below as well or also up here but 
today I want to take this opportunity to show

you a different version just you know it's always 
good to have different options right this one's a

little thicker a little sweeter goes super well 
with this pork so I'm actually gonna cook it so

I'm gonna start out with a little pot and I'm 
gonna melt my palm sugar and yes you definitely

want to use palm sugar for this because you want 
that depth of flavor and some tamarind quite a bit

of tamarind I actually got inspired by my recent 
trip to Thailand where I went to this barbecue

place and they had this thicker sweeter towel 
that was really quite good now to help us dissolve

without drying out and just add a splash of water 
oh look at that okay so now that it has completely

dissolved I'm just gonna cook it for just a minute 
or so longer to get it a little thicker that looks

perfect heat off but while it's still hot I'm 
gonna add diced finely diced shallots and the

so heat from the dipping sauce will help wilt 
and distribute all that oniony flavor if you

were thinking wait a minute she hasn't used fish 
sauce yet in her pork not to worry here it is and

I'm using my good smooth fish sauce for this which 
by the way if you want to have a couple different

types of fish sauce your smoother more expensive 
one is perfect for dipping sauces we're sort of

the cheaper one is great for cooking in general 
I'm gonna transfer just into my bowl here just

to help it cool down a little faster and so you 
can see better too of course it has to be spicy

so I'm gonna add Thai roasted chili flakes you 
can use cayenne pepper if you don't have it and

you'll be able to add more cayenne pepper because 
it's not as spicy if this stuff is really spicy I

made this myself so I can only add a little bit 
I'm gonna add for thickening and also for aroma

some toasted rice powder if you follow the show 
you've seen me make this several times but if

not if this is new to you don't worry I'll put all 
the information in the written recipe and also you

give you a link to a video that shows you exactly 
how it's made down below oh yes I still have some

lime juice that's gonna go in we've got some 
tamron but I never find that tamarind is quite

hard enough it's always a little bit sweet on the 
sweet side so I'm just gonna add some lime juice

but the measurement for this you kind of have 
to taste and adjust because it's going to differ

depending on how tart your tamarind is salivating 
give this a quick taste mmm oh so good so just

before serving or to throw in some fresh cilantro 
but now we got a grill the pork alright so here

I am on the balcony grilling it's a beautiful 
day perfect day for it now if you don't have

a barbecue for this you can just use what do you 
call it the oven put it under the broiler okay so

I've got my girl I'll heat it up whoo smoky I've 
oiled it and now I'm just gonna put down my pork

yeah and that sizzle is what you want and I'm 
getting smoked a smoked pie the thing with this

is the park is so thin it's only gonna take a few 
minutes and I'm not gonna actually close the list

I have found that if I close the lid it it cooks 
the park way too quickly like it it's because it's

so thin and it didn't have time to get any grill 
marks before it became overcooked so obviously

every grill is different I've gotten mine set on 
high because I'm leaving it open so it's losing

a lot of heat off the top and with this cut apart 
you don't want to cook it well-done because it's

not a tender cut it's a bit chewy so you want it 
almost medium okay let's see oh yes that looks

nice and as you can see this part is curled up 
around the edges that happens sometimes and what

that is is some tendon or some connective tissue 
that is sort of shrinking and pulling all the meat

up with it that will be chewy so if you see a 
part that's curled up just trim it off so you

want to make sure you give the meat a rest don't 
cut it immediately after you pull off the grill

otherwise all the juices will run out okay for a 
thin piece like this I would say 5-10 minutes is

plenty and so it's very important you cut this 
against the grain which is very obvious on this

piece because the grain runs lengthwise like this 
but if you don't do that it's very chewy and what

I like to do is go a little bit sideways because 
it's so thin that if you do it straight down you

get like tiny little pieces so most of the time in 
Thailand you see people serve it sideways and go

pretty thin again this is a really tasty cut but 
it's not always tender if you cut it too thick

this is perfect look at that perfect doneness you 
want still to be a little bit pink in the middle
I'm just finish it off with some fresh cilantro

now one mistake here I made is I should have 
waited till the last minute to stir in the toasted

rice powder so it doesn't absorb too much liquid 
but this is ok if wallah there is a plate as an

authentic Thai barbecue if you have some Keir 
ice it's perfect little dip and see because this

one is a little thicker it'll stay on the pork 
better it's so good Oh dark pork I'm just gonna

taste a piece just straight-up just so it can 
really taste the pork excuse my hand see what's

unique about this cut is it such a flavorful cut 
of pork you know how you eat like a pork chop

the middle of the pork chop is like the blandest 
thing ever but this because it has a lot of fat

running through its flavorful throughout and the 
marinade is of course helping with that too you

really taste that coconut milk and the garlic 
in the lemongrass Wow and if you want to like

step it up a notch that dipping sauce is perfect 
so I hope you give this recipe a try definitely

the next time you bring out your barbecue put this 
on the menu you won't regret it so the recipe as

always will be on hot hi kitchen calm when you 
make it send me a photo on Facebook Twitter or

Instagram and if you love the show and you'd like 
to support us check out our patreon page up with

the link in the description below and I will see 
you next time for your next delicious Thai meal
